represents the total amount of hedging bets that are—
paid or payable by the conductor; and

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the dividend payable on a hedging bet is expressed in a currency other than Hong Kong dollars, the amount of the dividend is to be converted to Hong Kong dollars at an exchange rate that is acceptable to the Collector as prevailing in Hong Kong when the dividend becomes payable; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the amount paid or payable for a hedging bet is expressed in a currency other than Hong Kong dollars, the amount is to be converted to Hong Kong dollars at an exchange rate that is acceptable to the Collector as prevailing in Hong Kong when the amount becomes payable.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1), a hedging bet is relevant to a charging period if, within that charging period, the person who received the bet—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: becomes entitled to forfeit the bet; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: becomes liable to pay a dividend on the bet.

subsection.leadIn: If, after the last charging period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a dividend becomes an unclaimed dividend, the dividend is taken to have become an unclaimed dividend within the last charging period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an unclaimed dividend is paid, the unclaimed dividend is taken to have been paid within the last charging period;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a dividend becomes payable on a hedging bet, the dividend is taken to have become payable within the last charging period; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the person who has received a hedging bet—

subparagraph.content: becomes entitled to forfeit the bet; or
becomes liable to pay a dividend on the bet,

paragraph.continued: the bet is taken to be relevant to the last charging period.

subsection.content: For this section, if a dividend is not paid within 60 days after the day on which the dividend becomes payable, the dividend becomes an unclaimed dividend at the end of the 60 days.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: hedging bet (對沖投注), subject to section 6WT(3), means a bet placed by a basketball betting conductor under section 6WT.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to any agreement made under subsection (3), charging period (課稅期), in relation to a basketball betting conductor, means a period within which the basketball betting licence issued to the conductor is in force, being—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a period that begins on the day on which the licence comes into force and ends on the earlier of the following—

subparagraph.content: the next following 31 March;
the date on which the licence is terminated; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any subsequent period that begins on 1 April and ends on the earlier of the following—

subparagraph.content: the next following 31 March;
the date on which the licence is terminated.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1), if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the term of the new licence is to start immediately after the termination of the original licence,

subsection.continued: that subsection applies as if the term of the new licence were an extended term of the original licence.

subsection.leadIn: The Collector may agree with a basketball betting conductor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a charging period that has begun but not come to an end, to change the date on which that charging period is to end; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a charging period that has not begun, to change either or both of the following dates—

subparagraph.content: the date on which that charging period is to begin;
the date on which that charging period is to end.

subsection.leadIn: An agreement made under subsection (3) has no effect if, according to the agreement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a day covered by a charging period is not covered by the term of the basketball betting licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a day covered by the term of the licence is not covered by any charging period; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a day covered by the term of the licence is covered by more than one charging period.

section.name: s6WM
section.heading: Basketball betting conductors must make provisional payments

subsection.content: A basketball betting conductor must make a provisional payment to the Collector within 15 days after each accounting day in a charging period.

subsection.leadIn: The amount of the provisional payment is calculated by using the following formula—
X – Y
where—

td.p: represents the amount of the basketball betting duty payable by the basketball betting conductor if the accounting day were the last day of that charging period; and
represents the total amount of the provisional payments that the conductor has made for that charging period.

subsection.content: A basketball betting conductor must, when making a provisional payment, submit to the Collector a calculation sheet in the specified form showing how the amount being paid is arrived at.

The Collector is to apply all provisional payments made by a basketball betting conductor for a charging period towards settlement of the basketball betting duty payable by the conductor for that charging period.
A basketball betting conductor that, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: accounting day (結算日) means any day within a charging period that is the last day of a month.

subsection.content: If a basketball betting conductor has not made a provisional payment in full, the Collector may, by a written notice given to the conductor, demand payment of the unpaid amount.
The notice must specify the way in which and the date by which the amount must be paid.
If the basketball betting conductor fails to make payment in accordance with the notice, the Government may recover the unpaid amount as a civil debt.

After the end of a charging period, the Collector must assess the amount of the net stake receipts derived from the conduct of authorized betting on basketball matches by a basketball betting conductor for that charging period.
The assessment may only be made within 6 years after the end of that charging period.

If, based on the assessment, the amount of the basketball betting duty payable by the basketball betting conductor exceeds the total amount of the provisional payments that have been made by the conductor, the conductor must pay the difference to the Collector in accordance with the notice of assessment.

If, based on the assessment, the total amount of the provisional payments that have been made by the basketball betting conductor exceeds the amount of the basketball betting duty payable by the conductor, the Collector must refund the difference to the conductor.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after making the assessment, the Collector must give the basketball betting conductor a written notice, specifying—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of the net stake receipts as assessed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of the basketball betting duty payable;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the total amount of the provisional payments that have been made;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if subsection (3) applies—

subparagraph.content: the amount that the conductor must pay; and
the way in which and the date by which the amount must be paid; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if subsection (4) applies—the amount that the Collector must refund.

section.name: s6WP
section.heading: Additional assessment of net stake receipts

subsection.content: This section applies if, despite having given a notice of assessment to a basketball betting conductor in relation to a charging period, the Collector reasonably believes that the amount of the net stake receipts derived from the conduct of authorized betting on basketball matches by the conductor for the charging period exceeds the amount of the net stake receipts as specified in the notice.
The Collector may make an additional assessment of the amount of the net stake receipts derived for that charging period.
The additional assessment may only be made within 6 years after the end of that charging period.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after making the additional assessment, the Collector must give the basketball betting conductor a written notice, specifying—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount of the net stake receipts as additionally assessed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of the additional basketball betting duty payable, and the way in which and the date by which the amount must be paid.

subsection.content: The basketball betting conductor must make payment to the Collector in accordance with the notice of additional assessment.

section.name: s6WQ
section.heading: Appeal against assessment, and holding over of basketball betting duty

subsection.content: A basketball betting conductor that is dissatisfied with an assessment under section 6WO, or an additional assessment under section 6WP, may appeal against the assessment to the District Court.
The appeal may only be made within 1 month after the date on which the notice of assessment or notice of additional assessment (as the case may be) is given.
The appeal must be made by giving a written notice of appeal to the Registrar of the District Court (Registrar) and the Collector.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after receiving the notice of appeal, the Collector must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: state and sign a case, setting out—

subparagraph.content: a summary of the facts that are relevant to the assessment concerned; and
how the assessment concerned has been made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: serve a copy of the case on the basketball betting conductor, the Registrar and the Secretary for Justice.

subsection.content: The appeal may only be set down for hearing within 14 days after copies of the case have been served in accordance with subsection (4)(b).

subsection.leadIn: The District Court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to determine the appeal by rescinding, varying or confirming the assessment concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may make any other order that the District Court considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: If, according to the assessment concerned, an amount is payable by the basketball betting conductor under section 6WO or 6WP (as the case may be)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the making of the appeal does not affect the conductor’s obligation to pay the amount; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Collector may, at the request of the conductor and subject to any conditions that the Collector may impose, order that payment of the whole or part of the amount be held over pending the final determination of the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a basketball betting conductor is required by a notice of assessment, or notice of additional assessment, to pay an amount by a date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Collector has ordered under section 6WQ(7)(b) that payment of the whole or part of the amount be held over pending the final determination of an appeal made by the conductor.

subsection.leadIn: If the basketball betting conductor withdraws the appeal, the conductor must pay the Collector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount that was held over; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: interest on the amount that was held over, calculated at the specified rate from the date referred to in subsection (1)(a) to the date on which the appeal is withdrawn.

subsection.leadIn: If, according to the final determination of the appeal, the amount payable by the basketball betting conductor under the assessment concerned exceeds the amount that was not held over, the conductor must pay the Collector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the difference between the two amounts; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: interest on so much of the amount that is held over and becomes payable as a result of the final determination, calculated at the specified rate from the date referred to in subsection (1)(a) to the date on which the appeal is finally determined.

subsection.leadIn: If an amount is payable by the basketball betting conductor under subsection (2) or (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Collector must give the conductor a written notice of payment, specifying—

subparagraph.content: the total amount payable; and
the way in which and the date by which the amount must be paid; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conductor must pay the amount in accordance with the notice given under paragraph (a).

subsection.content: The Government may recover any interest payable under this section as a civil debt.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified rate (指明利率) means the rate determined by the Chief Justice by order under section 50(1)(b) of the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336).

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a basketball betting conductor is required by a notice of assessment, notice of additional assessment or notice of payment given under section 6WR(4)(a) to pay an amount by a date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount is not fully paid by that date.

subsection.content: The Collector may, by a written notice given to the basketball betting conductor, demand the conductor to pay a surcharge.
The surcharge must not exceed 5% of the unpaid part of the amount referred to in subsection (1)(a).

If the amount referred to in subsection (1)(a) is not fully paid at the end of 6 months after the date referred to in that subsection, the Collector may, by a written notice given to the basketball betting conductor, demand the conductor to pay a further surcharge.

subsection.leadIn: The further surcharge must not exceed 10% of the total of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the unpaid part of the amount referred to in subsection (1)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the surcharge under subsection (2) is not fully paid at the end of the 6 months referred to in subsection (4)—the unpaid part of the surcharge.

subsection.content: The Government may recover any surcharge or further surcharge as a civil debt.

section.name: s6WT
section.heading: Basketball betting conductors may bet for hedging purpose

subsection.leadIn: A basketball betting conductor may place a bet on a basketball match if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the bet placed by the conductor is received by a person in a place outside Hong Kong in accordance with the law of that place; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the bet is placed by the conductor for the only purpose of hedging against exposure to the risk of loss that the conductor may suffer from the conduct of betting on the match.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a basketball betting conductor that places a bet under subsection (1) does not commit any offence under section 8 of the Gambling Ordinance (Cap. 148); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person who receives the bet does not commit any offence under section 7 of that Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: For section 6WK, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a basketball betting conductor claims that a bet was placed under this section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the conductor does not have an approved hedging policy; or
in relation to the placing of the bet—the Collector reasonably believes that the conductor has failed to comply with the approved hedging policy in a material way,

subsection.continued: the bet is not to be taken as a bet placed under this section.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (3)—
subsection.def: approved hedging policy (獲批准的對沖政策), in relation to a basketball betting conductor, means a policy submitted by the conductor and approved by the Collector under section 6WU.

section.name: s6WU
section.heading: Hedging policies of basketball betting conductors

subsection.leadIn: A basketball betting conductor may submit to the Collector for approval a policy (hedging policy) setting out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the factors that the conductor undertakes to consider in placing a bet under section 6WT; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the procedure that the conductor undertakes to follow in placing the bet.

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after receiving a hedging policy submitted under subsection (1), the Collector must inform the basketball betting conductor by a written notice if the policy is approved or not approved.
If the Collector approves the hedging policy, the notice must specify the date on which the approval is to take effect.

At any time after approving a hedging policy under subsection (2), the Collector may withdraw the approval of the whole policy, or of any part of the policy, by a written notice given to the basketball betting conductor.
A notice under subsection (4) must specify the date on which the withdrawal is to take effect.

section.name: s6WV
section.heading: Restrictions relating to basketball betting tickets

subsection.leadIn: A person must not make, print, issue, sell or offer to sell a basketball betting ticket unless the person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a basketball betting conductor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so acting on behalf of a basketball betting conductor.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: basketball betting ticket (籃球投注彩票) means a ticket that is used or to be used to—(a)record the placing of a bet with a basketball betting conductor; and(b)claim any dividend payable on the bet.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Secretary may, by issuing a licence to a company, authorize the company to conduct lotteries.

The Secretary shall not issue the licence to a company unless the Secretary is satisfied that the company, and all the directors, principal officers and controllers of the company, are fit and proper persons for the purpose of this section.
The term for which the licence is issued shall be specified in the licence.

subsection.leadIn: Issuance of the licence to a company is subject to the conditions that the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not accept, or authorize any person to accept, bets from juveniles;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not accept bets in any premises to which juveniles are permitted to have access;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall not entertain claims by juveniles for prizes;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: shall not advertise the conduct of lotteries on television or radio between the hours of 4:30 p.m. and 10:30 p.m. on any day; (Amended E.R. 5 of 2021)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: shall not, in conducting any advertising or promotional activity—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: target juveniles;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: exaggerate the likelihood of winning; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: expressly or impliedly suggest that betting on lotteries is a source of income or a viable way to overcome financial difficulties;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: shall not accept bets on credit, or accept credit cards as a means of payment for placing bets; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: shall conspicuously display and keep displayed notices that comply with subsection (6)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in any premises where the company accepts bets; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on any website, and mobile application, through which the company accepts bets. (Amended 38 of 2025 s. 16)

subsection.leadIn: Issuance of the licence is also subject to such conditions as the Secretary may think fit to impose, including but not limited to conditions relating to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the types of lotteries that may be conducted;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manner in which lotteries may be drawn;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the manner in which the results of lotteries may be announced; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the provision of information to the Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: Any notice referred to in subsection (4)(g) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contain a warning of the seriousness of the problems caused by excessive gambling; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide information on the services and facilities available in Hong Kong to problem gamblers and pathological gamblers.

section.name: s6Y
section.heading: Duty on and allocation of proceeds

subsection.content: A duty is charged at the rate of 25% on the proceeds of each lottery that is conducted by a lottery conductor.
The duty shall be payable by the lottery conductor.

subsection.leadIn: The conductor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall allocate 54% of the proceeds in prizes, whether in that lottery or any other lottery as the conductor may determine;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall pay 15% of the proceeds into the Lotteries Fund; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may retain 6% of the proceeds as commission.

subsection.content: The Legislative Council may, by resolution, amend the rate of duty and the percentages of allocation specified in subsections (1) and (3) respectively.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Lotteries Fund (獎券基金) means the Lotteries Fund established by a resolution made and passed by the Legislative Council on 30 June 1965 (Cap. 2 sub. leg. D) and published in the Gazette;
proceeds (收益) means, in relation to a lottery, the total amount of bets that are placed on the lottery.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not make, print, issue, sell or offer to sell a lottery ticket unless the person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a lottery conductor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so acting on behalf of a lottery conductor.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

def.name: LotteryTicket
def.leadIn: In this section, lottery ticket (獎券活動彩票) means a ticket that is used or to be used to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: record the placing of a bet with a lottery conductor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: claim any prize that is payable on the bet.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Provisions relating to licences issued under Part 3

section.name: s6ZA
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 5
section.def: Appeal Board (上訴委員會) means the Appeal Board established under section 6ZH;
licence (牌照) means a licence issued under section 6GB, 6I, 6WH or 6X. (Amended 17 of 2006 s. 17; 38 of 2025 s. 17)

subsection.content: The constitution of a licensed company shall not be amended without the prior approval of the Secretary.
Despite anything provided for in the constitution of a licensed company, any amendment of the constitution in contravention of subsection (1) shall be of no effect.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: constitution (章程) means, in relation to a company, the memorandum and articles of association of the company, or other instrument constituting or defining the constitution of the company;
licensed company (持牌公司) means a company that holds a licence.

section.name: s6ZC
section.heading: Codes of practice on compliance with licence conditions

subsection.content: For the purpose of giving guidance on how the conditions of licences may be complied with, the Secretary may from time to time issue codes of practice.
The Secretary may from time to time revise the codes.

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings, including appeals under section 6ZG, if it is relevant to decide whether the holder of a licence has failed to comply with a condition of the licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the holder is not taken to have failed to comply with the condition only because of the failure to comply with a code that relates to the condition; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a failure to comply with a code that relates to the condition shall be admissible in evidence.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may, by notice in writing given to the holder of a licence, vary the conditions of the licence by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: changing the terms of any condition that is imposed by the Secretary; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: imposing new conditions subject to which the licence is to continue in force.

subsection.content: The variation shall not take effect before the expiry of the period referred to in section 6ZG(2), being the period within which the holder of the licence may appeal against the decision of the Secretary to make the variation.

subsection.leadIn: The notice shall specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reasons for varying the conditions of the licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the variation is to take effect.

subsection.leadIn: Before varying the conditions of a licence, the Secretary shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give the holder of the licence a reasonable opportunity to make representations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consider the representations, if any.

subsection.content: The Secretary may, by notice in writing given to the holder of a licence, impose a financial penalty on the holder if the holder has failed to comply with a condition of the licence.

The holder shall not be required to pay the penalty before the expiry of the period referred to in section 6ZG(2), being the period within which the holder may appeal against the decision of the Secretary to impose the penalty.

subsection.leadIn: A financial penalty that is imposed on the holder of a licence shall not exceed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: $500,000 for the first occasion on which a financial penalty is imposed on the holder;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: $1,000,000 for the second occasion on which a financial penalty is imposed on the holder; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: $5,000,000 for the third or any subsequent occasion on which a financial penalty is imposed on the holder.

subsection.leadIn: The notice shall specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reasons for imposing the penalty;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of the penalty imposed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the manner in which and the date on or before which the penalty shall be paid.

subsection.leadIn: Before imposing a financial penalty on the holder of a licence, the Secretary shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give the holder a reasonable opportunity to make representations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consider the representations, if any.

subsection.content: The Secretary shall not impose a financial penalty under this section unless, in all the circumstances of the case, the financial penalty is proportionate and reasonable in relation to the failure that gave rise to the penalty.
A financial penalty shall be paid to the Government and the Government may recover any unpaid penalty as a civil debt.
If the holder of a licence has duly paid a financial penalty, the Secretary shall not revoke the licence only because of the failure that gave rise to the penalty.
For the purpose of this Part, if the Appeal Board has varied a financial penalty, the obligation to pay the penalty shall be discharged by paying the amount as varied.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may, by notice in writing given to the holder of a licence, revoke the licence if the holder has—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contravened this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: failed to comply with a condition of the licence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: failed to pay a financial penalty;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: gone into liquidation; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: entered into a composition or arrangement with its creditors.

subsection.content: The Secretary may also, by notice in writing given to the holder of a licence, revoke the licence if the Secretary is no longer satisfied that the holder, or any of the directors, principal officers or controllers of the holder, is a fit and proper person for the purpose of section 6GB, 6I, 6WH or 6X, as the case may be. (Amended 17 of 2006 s. 18; 38 of 2025 s. 18)

subsection.leadIn: The notice shall specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reasons for revoking the licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the revocation is to take effect.

subsection.leadIn: Before revoking a licence, the Secretary shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give the holder of the licence a reasonable opportunity to make representations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consider the representations, if any.

subsection.content: The Secretary shall not revoke a licence under this section unless, in all the circumstances of the case, the revocation is proportionate and reasonable in relation to the reason that gave rise to the revocation.

section.name: s6ZG
section.heading: Appeals against financial penalties, variation of licence conditions and revocation of licences

subsection.leadIn: If the holder of a licence is not satisfied with a decision of the Secretary to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: vary the conditions of the licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose a financial penalty on the holder; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: revoke the licence,

subsection.continued: the holder may appeal against the decision to the Appeal Board.

subsection.content: The appeal shall be made by giving a notice of appeal in writing to the Chairperson of the Board. The appeal may only be made within 30 days after the day on which notice of the decision is given to the holder.
If an appeal is made against a decision other than a decision to revoke a licence, the effect of the decision is suspended until the appeal is determined by the Board.
If an appeal is made against a decision to revoke a licence, the effect of the decision is not suspended by the making of the appeal.

section.name: s6ZH
section.heading: Establishment and composition of Appeal Board

subsection.content: For the purpose of determining appeals under section 6ZG, there is established an Appeal Board.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the Chief Executive shall appoint—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person, who is qualified for appointment as a District Judge under section 5 of the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336), as the Chairperson of the Board; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not less than 4 other persons as members of the Board.

subsection.content: No public officer shall be appointed under subsection (2).
As soon as practicable after a person is appointed under this section, or has ceased to be so appointed, the Secretary shall publish a notice of that fact in the Gazette.
A person who is appointed under this section may resign at any time by notice in writing given to the Chief Executive.

subsection.leadIn: The jurisdiction of the Appeal Board in determining an appeal shall be exercised by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chairperson of the Board; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not less than 2 members of the Board as the Chairperson may designate for the appeal.

subsection.content: Questions before the Board shall be determined by the majority of the persons hearing the appeal, and in the event of an equality of votes the Chairperson shall have a casting vote.
Hearing of an appeal shall be held in public unless the Chairperson decides that the hearing shall be held in private.
Subject to this Part, the Chairperson may decide on any matter of practice or procedure relating to the hearing of appeals.

subsection.leadIn: In determining an appeal, the Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receive evidence on oath;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: admit or take into account any statement, document, information or matter whether or not it would be admissible as evidence in a court of law; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by notice in writing, summon any person to appear before it to produce any document or to give evidence.

subsection.leadIn: If a notice is given under subsection (5)(c) to a person, and the person fails to, without reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: comply with the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: answer truthfully and completely a question put to him by the Board,

subsection.continued: the person commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3.

subsection.content: The Board shall determine the appeal by reversing, varying or confirming the decision that is appealed against. The determination is final.

section.name: s6ZJ
section.heading: Giving notices under this Division
section.content: A notice that is required to be given under this Division to the holder of a licence may be given by sending the notice to the address of the holder by registered post.

subsection.leadIn: A person who conducts an authorized betting activity shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep sufficient records, in the English or Chinese language, of all receipts, payments and other transactions relating to the activity, in such a manner that enables the duty charged under this Ordinance in relation to the activity to be readily ascertained; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: keep those records for a period of not less than 7 years after the completion of the transactions to which they relate.

def.name: Records
def.leadIn: In this section, records (紀錄) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: books of account (whether kept in a legible form, or in a non-legible form by means of a computer or otherwise) that record receipts and payments; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: vouchers, bank statements, invoices, receipts, and such other documents as are necessary to verify the entries in the books of account.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes this section commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

subsection.leadIn: On being so requested by the Collector, a person who keeps a record under section 6ZK shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce the record for inspection by the Collector at such place and time as the Collector may reasonably direct;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide to the Collector a copy or an extract of the record in such form as the Collector may reasonably direct.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes this section commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s6ZM
section.heading: Provision of certain information to Collector

subsection.content: If the Collector reasonably believes that any person has information that affects the amount of a duty that may be collected under this Ordinance, the Collector may, by notice in writing given to the person, require the person to provide the information to the Collector, in such form and before such date as may reasonably be specified in the notice.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes a requirement under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s6ZN
section.heading: Duty recoverable as civil debt
section.content: The Government may recover any duty payable under this Ordinance as a civil debt.

section.name: s6ZO
section.heading: Powers of Collector to correct errors and refund overpaid duty

subsection.content: Within 6 years after the end of a charging period, a horse race betting conductor, football betting conductor or basketball betting conductor may apply to the Collector for a correction of an assessment made under Division 2A, 3 or 3B of Part 3 in respect of the charging period. (Amended 38 of 2025 s. 19)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), after having received an application under subsection (1), the Collector shall correct the assessment if satisfied that the duty charged under that Division for the charging period is excessive by reason of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an error or omission in a return or statement submitted in respect of the charging period; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an arithmetical error or omission in the calculation of the amount of the net stake receipts or duty charged.

subsection.leadIn: If the return or statement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was submitted in respect of an assessment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: was in fact made on the basis of or in accordance with the practice generally prevailing at the time when the return or statement was made,

subsection.continued: the Collector shall not correct the assessment in respect of an error or omission in the return or statement as to the basis on which the liability to duty ought to have been computed.

subsection.content: If, after having made a correction under subsection (2), the Collector is satisfied that the conductor has paid duty in excess of the amount with which it was properly charged for the charging period, the Collector shall refund to the conductor the amount so paid in excess.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not operate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to extend or reduce any time limit for appeal or repayment specified in this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to validate any appeal which is invalid.

subsection.leadIn: If the Collector refuses an application under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he shall give notice in writing to the horse race betting conductor, football betting conductor or basketball betting conductor of the refusal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the notice being given, the conductor has the same rights of appeal under section 6GN, 6S or 6WQ as if the notice of refusal were a notice of assessment. (Amended 38 of 2025 s. 19)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: requiring persons who conduct authorized betting activities to provide to the Collector such information about the activities as the regulations, or the Collector, may specify; (Amended 17 of 2006 s. 20)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: empowering the Collector to require persons who conduct authorized betting activities to provide to the Collector such information about the activities as the Collector may specify; (Added 17 of 2006 s. 20)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing for the manner and period in which duties charged under this Ordinance shall be paid; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: providing for any matter that is necessary or expedient for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: securing the payment of duties charged under this Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: carrying out or giving effect to this Ordinance.

subsection.content: A regulation made under this section may provide that a contravention of any regulation is an offence punishable by a fine at level 3.
The Collector may specify forms for the purpose of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A person who evades, or assists another person to evade, a duty that is payable under this Ordinance commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 3, an additional fine and imprisonment for 6 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on indictment, to a fine at level 5, an additional fine and imprisonment for 3 years.

subsection.def: In this section, additional fine (附加罰款) means a fine of treble the amount of the duty that, because of the offence, has not been paid or underpaid.
